page.title: 14WILDLIFE IN CARTERTON & AREA
page.content: Within{Carterton}itself there is little opportunity for wildlife to flourish.Verges are cut short,most gardens are tidily kept and new housing has replaced the wilder areas. The airfield is mainly open grassland and runways.Birds are actively discouraged because of the{danger to {the aeroplanes.}Modern farming methods have destroyed many wild flowers in the cultivated areas but it is not all a story of gloom. Rabbits breed rapidly on the airfield. Fish have been reintroduced to the streams and trees replanted. The{disused railway {line}is a haven for wild flowers, 42 varieties were counted in a small region. Pheasants,partridge and hares find good cover in the winter wheat. Kingfishers and herons feed from the {Shill.}People are becoming more aware of the need to conserve wildlife.
